p: The distribution of lineage-level diversification rates across a representative approximate maximum likelihood tree from 2018 is presented in Fig. 1. Lineages associated with rapid and extensive branching are typified by high diversification rates. We showed that our diversification rate calculations were robust to tree-building methods and HIV genomic region (Supplementary Appendix). Although there was a slight increase in both mean and median diversification rate over time attributable to sampling from a larger tree (see Supplementary Appendix), the population-level distribution of diversification rates did not significantly change across the study period (Kruskal-Wallis, p = 0·385).
